722436f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Beekman Street
722436f-a.text:
Park Row, north from Beekman Street, to the Brooklyn Bridge Approach, (near North William Street). (Also shown is the intersection of Centre Street and Park Row). In the foreground is seen a portion of City Hall Park, with a minute portion of the City Hall on the extreme left, at its rear is observed the Hall of Records, and towering above all is the Municipal Building. (The pedestrian approach to the Brooklyn Bridge Station of the Second and Third Avenues Elevated is shown crossing Park Row
at Centre Street).
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
722436f-a.folder: Park Row & Beekman Street, Manhattan, NY

722434f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Beekman Street
722434f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, north across Beekman Street, showing an early view of the publishing center, popularly known as "Printing House Square". At the left is the terminus of Nassau Street, with its intersecting Frankfort Street. Note the "Sun" occupying the former Tammany Hotel. This Affectec is 1868 and the obvious construction of the old U. S. Post Cffice (photographer's vantage point) in 1869
dates this photo.
1868-70
Gift of Urbrock Collection  Vieag sw GW59
722434f-a.folder: Park Row & Beekman Street, Manhattan, NY

722435f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Beekman Street
722435f-b.text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Beekman Street, to and including Broadway. The view shows the United States Post Office on the right and St. Paul's Protestant Episcopal Chapel in the background.
May 26, 1904.
Brown Brothers.
(2)
Park Row,East Side and Mail Street,showing beginning of Post Office demolition.
August 23rd,1938
P.L.Sperr,
No Reproductions.
